meanings.definition: Having minute spaces or holes through which liquid or air may pass.
meanings.sent1: The sponge is porous and absorbs water easily.
meanings.sent2: The soil is porous, allowing water to seep through easily.
meanings.sent3: The porous rock looked like a sponge, ready to soak up any spills.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was porous, absorbing every detail of the story.
meanings.sent5: The porous fabric let the sunlight filter through in a beautiful pattern.

meanings.sent1: The porous membrane allows nutrients to pass into the cell.
meanings.sent2: The fabric is porous, allowing air to circulate and keep you cool.
meanings.sent3: The porous balloon deflated quickly when punctured.
meanings.sent4: His arguments were as porous as a sieve, full of holes.
meanings.sent5: The porous clay pot absorbed the excess moisture from the plant's roots.
